com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib

Class StandardHttpClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.WeatherClient
      • com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.StandardHttpClient

  • public class StandardHttpClient
extends WeatherClient
    This class represents the entry point to get the Weather information. This is another implementation of WeatherClient, this is a synchronous client and you should consider it when using this class in your main thread. This class uses a IWeatherProvider to parse the response. Internally this class is based on standard HttpURLConnection

    Usually you need only one instance of this class in your app so that the class implements the Singleton pattern To get the reference to this class you have to use getInstance method:

    WeatherClient client = StandardHttpClient.getInstance();

    soon after you the the reference and before you make any requests you have to pass the Context to this class.

    Author:
    Francesco Azzola

      • getCurrentCondition

        public void getCurrentCondition(java.lang.String location,
                       WeatherClient.WeatherEventListener listener)
                         throws ApiKeyRequiredException
        Deprecated. use instead WeatherClient.getCurrentCondition(com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.request.WeatherRequest, com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.WeatherClient.WeatherEventListener)
        Get the current weather condition. It returns a class structure that is indipendent from the provider used to ge the weather data. This method is an async method, in other word you have to implement your listener WeatherClient.WeatherEventListener to get notified when the weather data is ready.

        When the data is ready this method calls the onWeatherRetrieved passing the current weather information. If there are some errors during the request parsing, it calls onWeatherError passing the exception or onConnectionError if the errors happened during the HTTP connection

        Specified by:
        getCurrentCondition in class WeatherClient
        Parameters:
        location - a String representing the location id
        listener - WeatherClient.WeatherEventListener
        Throws:
        ApiKeyRequiredException

      • searchCity

        public void searchCity(java.lang.String pattern,
              WeatherClient.CityEventListener listener)
                throws ApiKeyRequiredException
        Search the city using a name pattern. It returns a class structure that is indipendent from the provider used that holds the city list matching the pattern. This method is an async method, in other word you have to implement your listener WeatherClient.CityEventListener to get notified when the weather data is ready.

        When the data is ready this method calls the onCityListRetrieved passing a List of cities. If there are some errors during the request parsing, it calls onWeatherError passing the exception or onConnectionError if the errors happened during the HTTP connection

        Specified by:
        searchCity in class WeatherClient
        Parameters:
        pattern - a String representing the pattern
        listener - WeatherClient.CityEventListener
        Throws:
        ApiKeyRequiredException

                        throws ApiKeyRequiredException
        Deprecated. use instead WeatherClient.getForecastWeather(com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.request.WeatherRequest, com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.WeatherClient.ForecastWeatherEventListener)
        Get the forecast weather condition. It returns a class structure that is indipendent from the provider used to ge the weather data. This method is an async method, in other word you have to implement your listener WeatherClient.ForecastWeatherEventListener to get notified when the weather data is ready.

        When the data is ready this method calls the onWeatherRetrieved passing the WeatherForecast weather information. If there are some errors during the request parsing, it calls onWeatherError passing the exception or onConnectionError if the errors happened during the HTTP connection

      • setProvider

        public void setProvider(IWeatherProvider provider)
        This method is used to set the Weather provider. The Weather provider must implement (IWeatherProvider interface. This method has to be called before making any HTTP request otherwise the client doesn't know how to parse the request
        Overrides:
        setProvider in class WeatherClient
        Parameters:
        provider - IWeatherProvider
        See Also:
        com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.provider.openweathermap.OpenweathermapProvider}, com.survivingwithandroid.weather.lib.provider.yahooweather.YahooWeatherProvider}

      • searchCity

        public void searchCity(double lat,
              double lon,
              WeatherClient.CityEventListener listener)
                throws ApiKeyRequiredException
        Search the city using latitude and longitude. It returns a class structure that is indipendent from the provider used that holds the city list matching the pattern. This method is an async method, in other word you have to implement your listener WeatherClient.CityEventListener to get notified when the weather data is ready.

        When the data is ready this method calls the onCityListRetrieved passing a List of cities. If there are some errors during the request parsing, it calls onWeatherError passing the exception or onConnectionError if the errors happened during the HTTP connection

        Specified by:
        searchCity in class WeatherClient
        Parameters:
        lat - a double representing the latitude
        lon - a double representing the longitude
        listener - WeatherClient.CityEventListener
        Throws:
        ApiKeyRequiredException
        Since:
        1.5.3

      • getCurrentCondition

        public CurrentWeather getCurrentCondition(WeatherRequest request)
                                   throws ApiKeyRequiredException,
                                          WeatherLibException
        Get the current weather condition. It returns a class structure that is independent from the provider used to ge the weather data. This method is synchronous so it has not to be run on the main UI thread.
        Parameters:
        request - WeatherRequest
        Returns:
        a valid CurrentWeather object
        Throws:
        ApiKeyRequiredException
        WeatherLibException

      • getProviderWeatherFeature

        public <T extends WeatherProviderFeature,S> void getProviderWeatherFeature(WeatherRequest request,
                                                                  T extRequest,
                                                                  GenericResponseParser<S> parser,
                                                                  WeatherClient.GenericRequestWeatherEventListener<S> listener)
        Get a specific weather provider feature not implemented in all weather provider

        When the data is ready this method calls the onWeatherRetrieved passing the HistoricalWeather weather information. If there are some errors during the request parsing, it calls onWeatherError passing the exception or onConnectionError if the errors happened during the HTTP connection

        Specified by:
        getProviderWeatherFeature in class WeatherClient
        Parameters:
        request - WeatherRequest
        extRequest - is the extended request as required by the weather provider
        parser - is the parser used to parsed the response GenericResponseParser
        listener - WeatherClient.GenericRequestWeatherEventListener
        Throws:
        ApiKeyRequiredException
